
<h4>Binomial coefficients</h4>

``choose()`` can be used to determine the number of ways $k$objects can be chosen from


\[
n \choose k = \frac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}
\]

The command takes the form <pre><code>choose(n,k)</code></pre><p>

<pre><code>
> choose(9,2)
[1] 36
</code></pre><p>

The factorial of a number can be computers using the ``factorial()`` command.
<pre><code>
> factorial(4)
[1] 24
</code></pre><p>
